channel.title: cli on IT Quicktasks
channel.description: Recent content in cli on IT Quicktasks

item.title: Dump MySQL Database but Skip Some Table(s)
How do you know the php.ini used via CLI
item.description: <?php $inipath = php_ini_loaded_file(); if ($inipath) { echo 'Loaded php.ini: ' . $inipath; } else { echo 'A php.ini file is not loaded'; } ?> or [icasimpan!@example.org ~]$ php -i |grep php.ini Configuration File (php.ini) Path => /etc Loaded Configuration File => /etc/php.ini But not that server and CLI used php.ini could be different. Details in https://stackoverflow.com/questions/14558150/how-to-know-which-php-ini-is-used

item.title: Mcrypt error when running 'composer install' from CLI
item.description: Verify if mcypt is really installed php -m|grep -i mcrypt Counter-check from phpmyadmin. If it say installed there, issue is that php-cli can’t see mcrypt as a module. Find the mcrypt definition and symlink similar to below: ln -s /etc/php5/mods-available/mcrypt.ini /etc/php5/cli/conf.d/20-mcrypt.ini See details in https://stackoverflow.com/questions/16830405/laravel-requires-the-mcrypt-php-extension

item.title: Dump MySQL Database
item.description: mysqldump -u<username> -p<password> --no-create-db myDB -h localhost > mysql.backup That way, it would strip the original database name and NOT become a problem when importing to another database name. See https://stackoverflow.com/questions/30835874/how-to-avoid-use-database-statement-on-mysqldump-backups

item.title: Acquia: Full Path to Database Backups Made via GUI
item.description: From CLI, ssh to specific server and go to: /mnt/files/[site].[dev | test | prod]/backups/

item.title: Drush ULI: disable automatic open in browser
Install Composer
item.description: curl -sS https://getcomposer.org/installer | php mv composer.phar /usr/local/bin/composer ln -s /usr/local/bin/composer /usr/bin/composer
